address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: When it arrived it wasn't what we had ordered and fairly cold, we did not eat it & instead braved the footpath to GARDIN! Might I suggest the villa staff would be wise to refer their visitors to Gardin (3 doors to the left) should they ask
Suzan Saban / Villa 8
The amenties in the villa were lovely and everything was presented beautifully
It was always the little extras that I Villa provided that made it stand out
The pools are not heated and largely under the shaded canopy of the amazing private gardens
I believe the villa was designed and built by Italian and indeed it is tastefully done
The location of the villa was fantastic
The actual villa is STUNNING
This villa was conceptualised and built under the eye of an Italian man two years ago and has recently been sold to, and opened by a Singaporean
After researching the area thoroughly, we were delighted to come across iVilla
It was the first time we stayed in a villa

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: OverallA lovely decorated hotel situated in a peaceful area of seminyak but not too far from the main strip
It is located in a quiet area of Seminyak which was perfect for us
They provide decent toiletries and even cotton buds which was really helpful

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: We were repeatedly told that this black volcanic soil had special nutrients for your beauty and total wellness! So don't miss the spa experience! It was our second visit
We stayed in one of the Kaymar rooms which was beautifully furnished and decorated, with great views over the gardens, swimming pool and the sea
This is a great area if you wish to get away from it all and be completely relaxed

The hotel is ideal to spend some days there in total relax (would suggest to use it as a basis for excursions only for the area of eastern Bali, even though the place is so beautiful and calm that it is nice to spend some days just there)
Francesca and Roy
There are dozens of frangipani trees lining the paths amidst the ubiquitous coconut palms
a hidden sanctuary indeed
I was previously spoilt by an out of this world meal when at JuMaNa at Ungasan Banyan Tree during our first week but even though this food was still excellent
We mentioned the fish dishes were good wrapped in banana leaf
Yoga on the lawn was a real nice treat
Personally we found it very average but so worth doing just to really see the area
All of the materials in the spa are natural - coconut oil with ylang-ylang from the resort garden, banana leaves, aloe, etc
We were then shown to our room Baruna which was a villa
There is Yoga on the lawn and other (complimentary) activities all day
"Miss Louise"
potential clients need to be aware that it is not near any other tourist facility but this is the way we wanted it
We stayed in the villa and it was so amazing I didnt want to leave
And another groundsman
candlemaking, drawing on lontar leaves, yoga and exercise classes, creativity walk,a healing workshop, starlight gazing etc
After a few hectic weeks in Bali, days spent sleeping in, eating, lazing by the pool together, participating in activities such as palm leaf carving and yoga, or spa treatments was ideal
The garden is a pleasure, the massages very well done
Only suggestion is to remove the buddha head statue on the ground under the tree in the garden
You don't have to worry for staying longer and get bored because the hotel have arrange alot of activities during the day around the hotel area
Have to say this was our favourite of the 2 hotels by a margin, and the other was a Banyan Tree
The swimming pool was big, cool and clean, and there were plenty of loungers/huts to sunbathe or relax in the shade
The other activities at the resort were quite entertaining - I made a Balinese offering and we did leaf carving and star gazing
Tiziano & klara
We went in early July 2013 and there lots of frangipani flowers
We opted for Kamar room with a garden access (room 32)
All in all, a good, relaxing stay, but found it to be too far, too healthy and could of gotten the same somewhere closer to Ubud, or Seminyak area

We did classes on candle making - lotus flower shape, drawing and etching on to leaves creating bookmarks, a cooking class making a vegetable curry which we ate afterwards and I also had a go at making a local health remedy for back, knee and skin conditions
We mainly chose the creative route so made a flower candle, a body scrub, decorated palm leaves, cooked a desert and carved a fruit
The gardener Norman (turtles) lovely man and so much knowledge

The unfailing charm of the staff and management, the sense of absolute tranquility, the beautiful setting with frangipani, mango and palm trees, the little frogs that appear in the garden every evening, the faultless interior design

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: This is a tiny pool surrounded by concrete with no shade and no loungers or umbrellas
A bit far from the commotion of kuta and seminyak but great area if u want a nice quiet holiday
The area where the hotel is, is great
It is quite pricey in the area compared to other areas in Bali such as Kuta or Ubud

My husband and I purchased 2 Groupons for Ion Bali Benoa for our 7 night stay in Bali from Feb 21st-28th and despite the lack of activities and atmosphere in this area, (which of course is not their fault) has multiple areas we were not satisfied with causing us to relocate to another hotel 2 days in on the 23rd

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: It is in the double six area of Bali
Well located, immaculately clean, nicely done up with cool garden / outdoor area / foyer
(Pricing is pretty good too)Pool: The pool area is very nice and right next to the bar/restaurant area, as many others have written in their reviews, the pool is very cold and in the shade
A really cool lounge/bar area which is a nice spot to relax
They helped us organise a trip to the safari park
Frist impression for this hotel i think this is surf board factory
Near to Kuta & Legian area
It is two roads away from the busy Kuta/Legian party area
This resulted in a pretty unsafe footpath and it was difficult to walk to JL Legian/Jl Melasti quickly
don't worry if you want to go to Kuta or other area
Pool is nice but in shade all day and unfortunately far too cold to swim in
Location, a bit out of the main Kuta area, not safe to walk back in the night as the road outside is dark
This area is covered so you can stay outside when it's raining
The hotel and facility was very good and clean
Noel! Simply the funniest and nicest person I met at Bliss
If I had to fault anything there wasn't enough umbrellas around the pool but plenty of shade from the tree's

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: The hotel is elegantly set out as a series of low level rooms & villas amongst beautifully-kept gardens, with the added attraction of being right on the long sandy beach stretching from Kuta to Sanur
It is not pumping, it is quite, discreet, relaxed, and located in a beautiful rambling garden, right on the beach in Seminyak which is now THE area to be
The garden setting of all rooms and always helpful staff make this a very special place

This meant that on one occasion when I wanted to have a swim I had to sit on the grass until a lounge became free; on some other days I had to put my swim back a few hours until later in the afternoon when it was quieter
Before the Oberoi, we stayed at the Banyan Tree Ungasan
My husband and I stayed here for ten nights in August for our honeymoon, staying in a villa with a garden and a pool
The gardens and the pool area v clean and well taken care of
This actually turned out not to be a compromise at all as we had a good view of the ocean across the gardens and were very pleasantly surprised
The hotel grounds are absolutely breathtaking, there are mature trees, flowers and little ponds all around

We loved it!We didn't eat at the restaurant as there are so many to choose from in Seminyak and the Oberoi is much more of a retreat destination - chill by the pool, watch the sunset and enjoy the gardens
It is worth every extra rupiah to upgrade to a villa
Set among scattered Hindu temples and manicured and incense fragranced gardens, the Villa rooms are immaculate and spacious
The Frangipani cafe has the best breakfast is SE Asia, get the local Balinese fare or the Indian food
The standard garden room is clean tidy and felt secluded as the villas are all spread out, however was not the largest or most modern we stayed at in bali
The Oberoi is located on the beach with all rooms in a beautiful and quiet garden
Having stayed several times, it doesn't really matter where you are - either garden or sea glimpse view - the quality of the accommodation is the same
This hotel still has that old Bali charm, the thatched lanais modernised inside, manicured gardens and a pool without slides! beautiful smiles, great service
The gardens are opulent, mature and peaceful

In a sense The Oberoi is the "Grand Dame" of Bali, she has the most beautiful gardens, the best of the beach, it is a short walk to all that is happening in Seminyak and the One bedroom Villa's are bigger than a typical suburban home
The grounds are full of flowers, trees and the occasional hammock
The grounds are kept spotless, gorgeous flowering plants and trees everywhere
The villa was spacious, very attractive, and spotlessly clean

Beware, the complimentary sunscreen (SPF30) does not work, we both burned when using it (and we were reapplying regularly, sitting in the shade etc – it was not through our own incompetence!) The service in parts of the hotel is pretty sub-par (for a hotel of this star rating) – for example at breakfast it was difficult to get anyone’s attention after making your initial order; the swimming pool staff pretty much forgot everything I asked for and needed to be reminded; slow bar service
The accommodation itself is very well appointed with individual lanais set in peaceful gardens
The shower is over the dated sunken bath which looks over a small walled garden

Every drop of apprehension disappeared the moment that we entered the exclusive driveway to The Oberoi: the greeting, the gardens, the welcome recepcion, the pool, beach, restaurants, accommodation and friendly, prompt, polite services, was excepcional from start to finish
Your private air conditioned room offers a haven where you are supplied with ongoing complimentary bottled water, newspaper and quietness surrounded by manicured gardens and lily ponds
Lotus flowers, old growth frangipani trees and fragrant incense fill your head space and that's just the driveway
2) Hotel ground: beautifully maintained meadow and completely enjoyable just walking around
We stayed in two garden lanai rooms and they gave us the same rooms we had previously

This is from the biys eho keepmthe garden, to the staff at the checkin/checkout desk, the restaurant, pool and boutique, there is not one which didnot reflect the "oberoi" spirit!! Our waiter at the breakfast restaurant even remembered what we always wanted, a nice personal touch, and Mr
Lush tropical gardens and trees set in acres of rolling lawns
On arrival we were greeted with fresh flower garlands and a welcome cocktail
One of the best in the Seminyak area
the rooms, the garden, the pool area, the friendly, helpful staff & so much more
We stayed in one of the garden lanai's which cost $445 a night and so we had a few expectations
The subsequent walk through beautifully-kept gardens to your room, past lotus ponds and age-old trees, further make you believe you are indeed in paradise
I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying in the area - worth every dime!
- The Balinese countryside is still unchanged and amazing
The truth be known, it was actually difficult to find the motivation to leave the blissful gardens and stunning beach view as everything was so perfect and peaceful
We had reserved a garden villa but at check-in were informed that we had been upgraded to a pool villa at no extra cost, a delightful and very appreciated surprise

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: It's about in the middle of those area
The facility overall looks and feels modern/clean!

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: We didnt want to leave and if we could have cancelled our next 3 night villa stay we would have
No replacement for the mineral water5
The area is safe for tourists
I would definitely consider returning even though I did miss the quieter and more traditional cottage type accommodation surrounded by gardens
It's open area, when it rained,
Beautiful pool area with plenty of comfortable sun beds in the shade (or sun)
There is no attraction to even be out in this area
We had notified the hotel that it was our honeymoon and the room was decorated with flower petals
We booked Sanur area for first few days of stay to have a nice quiet relax before moving to Pullman in Kuta
I would definitively recommend the hotel and the area
As we walked to our room the pool was lit up with its gardens
The plants did their best to survive but clearly they were not taken care of properly (or some guest decide to play god and killed them all

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia
hotel_name: Balibaliku Beach Front Luxury Private Pool Villa

reviews.review: We first stayed in the Monsoon Lodge
Apparently that's because this area is a very unique microclimate
The Menjangan is a wonderful and special place, slightly remote, in a national park, ideal to explore nature
We had a villa all to ourselves
We chose the place naturally because of the location in the national park
we've been to the menjangan during the dry season - already then it's fantastic and we could only imagine how it would be when everything blossoms and grows
Friendliness of the butler was sometimes a bit intrusive, and to go anywhere you need the jeep of the hotel because it's a national park, everything is far away from civilization
Although it was dry season and much of the national park was dry and parched

By the location of the hotel within the national park, I accept that there will be insects and so on, but that is no excuse for the lack of basic care of the property and clean conditions for the guests
The Menjangan area is absolutely beautiful and a wonderful escape from the hustle and tourism of central/south Bali
Its setting is fantastic in the National Park with everything that brings
Very quiet and peaceful as this is the only place to stay within the national park
The location and the concept as such (“jurassic park style”, the tower in the tree tops…) make it an experience
We had deer visit on the front lawn, a troupe of macaques (thankfully not dependent on humans) move past regularly and a wide range of birdlife

I leave and work in Bali and in my days of I planned an escape in Mejangan as I wanted to stay away from the crowds I had to stay in the Actual Park and this was my best and wise as it prove to be choice
Indeed this site is so far away from many popular area
The butlers were all so friendly and always willing to give us more information about the wildlife who lived in the park
And the we love the frangipani series! Everything in the villas is just beautiful
If you choose to stay here you will be in the middle of the national park, so if your into shopping, clubs, pub and nightlife then rethink your destination
Of course they'll happily drive you anywhere within the park, but sometimes you just want to walk through the lovely surrounds
a luxurious villa in a ideal location
The previously endangered Bali starling can be found at the Monsoon Lodge and are easily photographed
Situated in a national park, we were able to experience a peaceful, relaxing aspect of Bali
Closer to home, the fact that the resort's 50m jetty starts in the mangroves and finishes in a genuine coral garden is just amazing
I have never seen any deer in the wild before, it was a great experience
We also adopted two trees, we really liked that initiative
We loved Coral Garden and Bat Cave
The hotel is in a national park that is very remote vs
We saw deer all over the place
And also tried a nice Sunset horse ride with Australian horses in the national park

With only a handful of rooms in the heart of the jungle of the West Bali National Park this resort combines spectacular lush tropical rainforest, wild deer and monkeys, mangroves, beach and pristine blue waters, all against the dream-like backdrop of volcanoes in Java and Bali
Paradise does excist in this area of Bali and the hotel is absolutely stunning! We stayed at the Monsoon area, a lovely room with a small terrace and the pool in front
The Monsoon Lodge was clean and pristine
I did not mind having one or two leaves in the water as swimming in the shade is great
Step off the canoe and get yourselves dirty - after all, you are in a national park, not in some departmental store
The Menjangan Resort is located within the fringes of West Bali National Park
Due to being in the National Park the resort is not big and is very private
We started at 6 am, only the guide and me, and went slowly and very silent and saw : a mother deer and young (looking very astonished), pairing butterflies, a giant flying squirrel, many many birds
Right in the middle of the national,park
We spotted couple of times Menjangan itself, monkeys playing between trees, giant lizards, squirrels and the famous endangered Bali sterling during our bird watching trekking
It is located in its own private part of forest, which is part of the West Bali Barat national park

Being a horse owner myself and loving Australian Stockhorses and committed to the way of riding these working horses in a healthy way I had looked so much forward to riding through the natural park with my daughter
this resort inside national park
Very nice about the park is that we saw monkeys, deers, beautiful birds very near to us
We went to The Menjangan for 4 days, it is a peaceful retreat in a gigantic national park
We went there however in November without leaves on the trees and very few guests
The resort itself is located in a National Park and is quite spread out
The hotel also has stables and offers horse riding through the National Park
It is a huge area in the National Park A little bus which you can sit on top of, like on safari takes you around the resort, deers, monkeys and lots of birds can be seen
Set within a national park this is the quietest spot in Bali
We didn't know what to expect when we booked The Menjangan, as no photos can do it justice, but the minute we arrived, we fell in love with this place, set in a vast National Park
No mass production - everything is individually prepared
But if what you've read about here intrigues you, it only gets better once you're actually in the park
Would love to see some sustainable practices introduced to the Housekeeping and Pest control management of this hotel, especially as it is within the National park
The setting in the National Park is sensational and you get exactly what you come here for - peace & tranquility, nature on your doorstep and excellent ammenities
The area is very big
The location is amazing and as you are in a National Park (only in Indonesia can you build a resort in a national park) they can charge what they like and they DO!!!!
The place is very unspoilt and tranquile with the protected national park sorrounding
This is supposed to be the top hotel in Menjangan area
My wife and I spent 5 nights at The Menjangan and chose it for its location inside Bali Barat National Park as well as for the pampered stay promised by their website
A beautiful location in the national park, quiet and peaceful with plenty of activities including amazing snorkeling
so you can fill your room at anytime with these wonderful smells and feel like beeing in a flower garden! If you like watching animals (deers, monkeys, wild chicken, etc
We didn't see a single notice asking guests not to feed the wild animals, something we would have expected in a national park
I really enjoyed the Coral Garden, Eel Garden and Anker Wreck sites
The activities are really nice as well: riding horses in the park and on the beach, snorkeling in the magnificent water of Menjangan Island, massages
We stayed 3 nights at The Menjangan in the National Park

The air is fresh and you are surrounded by beautiful scenery both above and below the waves Even though you are in the middle of a national park you would never know it given the level of services available
It's a little expensive for this area but well worth the every penny
In addition there was a large waterpot which was used by the local deer
We had travel for 3 days, this is not the 1st time we are going to menjangan area
We stayed in the Monsoon Lodge
The villa was amazing
The villa was quite simply stunning
10 Steps from our villa

Thanks to Ngurah who genuinely arranged our last minute booking, Gelgel who taken care of our daily activity, We'll definitely come back to spend our next holiday and plant the trees since it was forgotten
In the park you can find a lot of animals, like deers and monkeys
We were upgraded to a beachfront villa and treated like royalty
We went during the rainy season, but had more than enough sun for enjoying this lovely park
we went thru the West Bali National Park (since the resort was on the middle of the 380 hectare park!)

We regret not staying there for a longer time!The hotel is located at a national park (west of Bali), it would take like 4-5 hours drive from airport, but I would still recommend you to go if you are looking for a quiet and relax place

The snorkelling was excellent off the Menjangan Island and me and wife also took part in the Tree planting program and planted a tree in our name which hopefully we can see the next time we visit this place
Originally we had booked garden rooms but upgraded ourselves to the beach villas
The views were otherworldly with mangrove trees, rocky beaches, forests (and all the creatures that go with them) at your doorstep
The setting is truly special: in the middle of the national park, you really feel like you are somewhere remote
The reality of this park is that it's on a very dry, remote corner of Bali, and it gets incredibly hot from about 10 am to about 4 pm
We loved this resort and felt that it was an amazing accomplishment to provide such excellent food, accommodation and service in the middle of a national park
The park/reserve is a great place to stay, very dry when we were there but lack of leaves aids visibility
They also arrange a romantic dinner on my husband birthday on the 6th Oct, it was great…They set the dinner on secluded area in one of their private open-air gazebo
The Monsoon Lodge room was gorgeous
The stunning beauty of a national park aside, you live well here
The setting is idyllic surrounded by the West Bali National Park and the tranquil waters looking out to Menjangan Island
The buggies which transport you around the park (if you don't fancy walking in the heat) are great for spotting many other interesting birds and other species

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: ’ We really didn’t know that this room belongs to hotel or villa
The location was important to us we love the area and wanted to be within waking distance to everything
The villa is very cool
Thank you so much for upgrading us into the Villa!

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: The hotel sent flowers too
we knew it was in a very busy area and all the night life was only down the alley(drive way) or 100 mtrs away,, we slept very well every night
There is a arch way to cottages and his businesses is just there on the right through the archway
The location was also very good, close to the local pub/club life and shopping down Poppies 1 & 2
This hotel is a major draw card for me to actually stay in the area again

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: location is good, very strategic area
The closest one is the Discovery Mall and Waterboom park
Also, small parking area may caused dificulty @ drop area
Terrible parking area, I feel sorry to my partner about my decision to choice this hotel
Cotton buds
This hotel is like a factory they have so many guests
Close to Discovery mall, waterboom park and Kuta beach
Perfect rooms, beautiful pool with small gardens as well as breakfast menu it's just good
Hotel may not be that big, but it completes with all facility you need to enjoy
My cousins got the room facing the garden, but no balcony
enjoyed lots stayin in that area
And also the parking area is so limited
Overall, this is nice hotel with good location in Kuta Area
No good if you want to work on your tan
This newly open hotel in Bali Kuta area is highly recommened
The different for birthday person in 3 stars hotel, our cake and flowers are not free, if we compared with 5 stars hotel in Bali area, they gave us free for its
If you are ok with the traffic jam, then it's ok to stay here, But if you don't want to be stuck in the traffic jam, better you stay in Seminyak area
It's a tourist area
Close to everything ie, Centro, Waterbom Park and across the road is a huge hypermart
Parking area is too small
The problem is only for their parking area, it's too small
The only thing that needs to be improved is the parking area, needs to be more spacious

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: The Villa is gorgeous! The pool is clean and the room is soooooo big with dining area, living room function and a super big bathroom
Though the villa is a bit dated, but if you need a private, relaxing and quiet place to be, this is it
When we got to the villa, it was like what some of the other reviewers stated
Villa was clean and very spacious
The gardens were beautiful, breakfast every morning served with a smile and the massage in your own suite was really relaxing
They have offered to let us swim at another villa but that's just pain in the butt
The premise was well kept and very pretty with lots of flowers
The villa was just beautiful
We simply went and bought a few packets of incense and placed them all around the garden beds that surrounded our open plan villa
The villa is private and secure, a and has a lovely well maintained garden area
Sanyas is aptly named for a retreat from the busy tourism of the area

The villa itself was spacious, clean and in short, stunning! One small downside was that the massive bathtub took more hot water to fill than was available, but there was so much else to do we hardly gave it a second thought! We will definitely return!
The villa we stayed, was superb
This caused the place to be overrun with mosquitos
The Villa was absolutely outstanding
The villa is big, and very comfortable
We received a warm and friendly welcome upon arrival, and were almost speechless when we saw our beautiful villa

Pros: Room/villa is huge with private pool outdoor, sheltered jacuzzi, two showers - one in the open concept bathroom and the other in the garden, separate bedroom, living room, dining area and kitchen
coz our villa could be seen thru and thru
There are alot of mosquitos but they do not bother you
We had a small and cute villa that suited us
arrived to a bathtub filled with flowers in the shape of a heart (very romantic)

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: Wise decision because aside from a beautiful setting, lovely gardens and extra special rooms, the overal service was excellent
I recently stayed at The Westin Nusa Dua for 6 nights (2rooms) in a deluxe garden view room, with my mother sister and 2 children 6 & 4
The surroundings were beautiful in the Nusa dua area
Our room went out into gardens and a short walk to one of their three pools or the beach front
Our room was a good size with a view over the lovely gardens
Beautiful complex, superb lush gardens, great pools, lovely clean beach and had a heavenly bed each day of our stay -just great
Location is enclosed area, nothing in at least 15mins walk distance
It's beachfront location, midsize, very comfortable deluxe garden terrace rooms on the ground floor for access for the older person was perfect
Each has indoor and outdoor playground
Wish there's a common facility for couples to enjoy
We like a garden terrace room and once again we were not disappointed with our choice
It was my birthday and the hotel kindly put flowers and a cake in the room as a surprise for me
Squirrels
upgraded to a Garden Terrace for more space
The rooms are comfortable with ultra-soft beds, a large tub, a hug shower, Cable TV, a balcony (in my case overlooking the garden)
) and got our own garden
The hotel is situated inside a large area ear-marked for tourists by BTDC, the local tourism board
They had some novel activities--origami, wall climbing, coconut leaf creations but the highlight was the kite making and kite flying
The gardens are well kept and beautiful
It was spacious with a King bed and a balcony overlooking the Spa gardens
Loved the public areas , the gardens & the pools & esp the murial on the external wall
However if you are planning to explore outside of the Nusa Dua area be prepared for a relatively long commute
Only a limited number of beds there which one family took all the whole visit, need more shade for children or a bigger pool for us to take kids in
If Westin are going to maintain this rule they need to upgrade the baby/toddler area, which is tiny and not enough space for very active toddlers
Location is a little remote, in the prime and exclusive Nusa Dua area
To swoisty raj wśród palm, z hotelowym dostępem do plaży, basenami, "bawialniami"
Will probably stay there if I return to the area
Nusa Dua is the safest area in Bali, so do not have any qualms about the true tranguility
We booked a garden view room with 2 doubles and a balcony through our travel agent as we wanted to be able to sit outside while the kids were having a day time sleep
It is well maintained with nice gardens and friendly staff
The standard garden rooms with the 2 double beds are lovely and spacious for a couple
The good is that there is a large playground, plenty of organized activities such as craft making
Deluxe king size garden view is quiet, spacious enough for two adults
there are number of properties in all area
Westin has surprised us with cake, card and flowers on our anniversary day
Stayed in a deluxe garden view room with a friend for a couple of nights
I tried to ask again and he pointed to the schedule list (half hidden by a tree) with his chin
The hotel and grounds were beautifully maintained with fresh paint and amazing tropical gardens

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: We barely spent anytime in our villa cos it was really awful
The property is gorgeous and we were more than happy with our villa! The price is definitely unbeatable especially when compared to hotels in the States
I stayed at this villa recently for 5D4N and it was a pleasant stay overall
The outside of the villas are really nice - loved the hanging foliage and wooden doors
We booked this Villa via scoupon and it didn't disappoint
The villas are clean, well maintained and have lovely tropical gardens out the front of each villa
One bad thing about the villa was that our villa main power switched off a few times

We were told that the villa with gazebo had sun beds when I called the hotel, well again this is not true there was 2 massage tables, not sun beds!! Would I recommend this villa complex or stay here again no, for the reason that none of our concerns were addressed, just remember its not where the charm gathers
We would try to be back in the villa between 11
When I check in and to my surprise I found the villa were very clean and spacious
Cleaning was always done while we were away from the villa, whether this was deliberate or not I'm not sure, but we always returned to a clean villa
The villa’s are just as described in the photos
Recommend this villa!
This Villa was great
Being open there is no way to regulate the temperature and we found this area uncomfortably warm, even after dark, and no way to keep out the swarms of hungry mozzies
Villa Kayu is a great place to stay if you want to get away from kuta
It has a little more of a 'hotel' feel to it rather than villa however
I would definitely recommend this Villa to friends
this is the worst villa we have ever stayed in
One good example is when we had a party for some friends in the villa
Kayu Raja Villa is a lovely 3 storey private villa
A few Mosquitos but they light a coil every night for you, so you can hang out in the open living area
This was our first time travelling to Bali as a family and i was a bit nervous about choosing Kayu Raja villas as we had nevr stayed in this area before
Aside from a noisy neighbour, you could really actually relax here
Beware of the Mosquitos though
Check in was fast and efficient and we were then taken to our villa (#18) and were blown away at just how lovely it was
Thank you Villa Kayu Raja
The villa was excellent
Thank you Villa Kayu Raja for making our stay an amazing one
The same leaves and debris were in there the whole time
The Villa was very spacious & split level
And they make good choice,for me, at Villa Kayu Raja
Location is good as it's just about 10 mins walk to the area of W hotel on Petitenget Rd
Thank you Villa Kayu Raja
Villa Kayu Raja was very safe and is Recommended Highly
The villa is very nice and we enjoyed our stay alot
Just the Villa needs to have a better sound proofing
We checked in quickly and immediately escorted to our two storey villa
The location of the Villa is not exactly central, but it is quiet
Villa are kept clean and I liked that they lite the mozi coil each night for you
The villa isn’t walkable distance to much else
The villa looks exactly like the pictures
What more could you want!We enjoy this area of Bali
i believe this villa is perfect for honeymooners
The villa was very spacious and relaxing, hard to find a fault over our entire stay here
I would definitely recommend a stay at the Villa Kayu Raja
Absolutely delicious and the combination of the herbs leaves you wanting more
The area at night, I did not like
We found the villa through a special and got so much more than what we thought we would
My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Villa Kayu Raja
Firstly, there was no air con in that area so you really couldn't sit there and enjoy during the humid/hot season
Overall a fantastic stay and would recommend the villa
The villa was very very comfortable
I cannot speak highly enough of Villa Kayu Raja
Villa Kayu Raja thank you for our wonderful stay and please say hi to Gusti from his friends from the Netherlands, we will miss him!
Villa Kayu Raja is so close to everything yet still quiet
The villa was cleaned daily to perfection
We stayed for two night in this villa
so cannot be called a villa
The villa is nicely designed, one villa was so close to another but the place was quiet and peaceful
They told me it was from a bat
We stayed in a one unit cottage which was out of the world
It's well documented that the pool is in the shade

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: Thank you so much Rym
1st floor room is connected to the garden, so recommended
If you are looking for an all-inclusive with activities in the Nusa Dua area we preferred the Grand Mirage in Benoa (5 minutes away)
The facilities and gardens are postcard perfect, and you can't take a bad photo here
The Coconut garden has warm soft grass under our feet and tall coconut trees over our heads creating shades for us to relax and play in
the room I a deluxe park facing room) was second huge disappointment so much so that I completely refused to check into that room and met the manger and asked him to upgrade us if possible
Never had an issues getting a sunlounge or anything, and there was a good amount of shade and sun over the pools
Plantation is very nice
But above all, we would like to say a big Thanks to Manu and Olan in the sports area
When I want to playing squash, 1 racket provided to me is faulty
Location is in a nice quiet area of Bali
Apart from that it was ok Clubmed has a a lot of grass area and they have started to refurbish the rooms

We didn't book any tours as we had already been to our favourite places in our first week but I thought they were overpriced and they didn't even offer the best Elephant Park in Turo, only the second-rate unsafe one
After being to a few club meds world wide (cancun,opio and Maldives) I have to say that the overall area is very big where the Bali club med is located
I must say certain aspects were wonderful like the grounds were immaculate, clean, manicured lawns and beautiful tropical greenery
Emma
Karim and johnno: ill leave that for you both to make it happen
I give them only 2/10 in this area
It was a very good one, it was shaded and also was very large in area
Why we consider it value for money:* Spacious accomodation overlooking manicured gardens* Amazing buffets or a la carte meals* Unlimited drinks
They created a lot of nice, cosy places to sit; near the pool, beach in the gardens
Lush green grass, bright red little cabanas as far as you can see
We would just like to thank some of our new Club Med friends Juan, Kris, Mark, Olan, Stef Lee, Jeff, Kane, Ash, Oman, Ketut, Jayrate and of course the Circus team again! We will definitely be back!
Whilst there are many "free" things on offer, I suggest spending the extra money on a garden level room for convenience
Special mention to the pitch and putt 6 holes facility which made our stay even more enjoyable
Gardens were amazing, could not be faulted
This venue is in a secure area and located next to Sofitel and the Whiz Hotel
We have always stayed at villa's in Bali, but no longer! Club Med all the time from now on
fantastic for families with rolling green grass for the kids to play on, safe kids pool and large main pool, supervised kids activities and lots of them, large beach area

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: Full of greenery from the surrounding rice or padi fields
Can’t recommend this place enough as is truly a special villa complex
The living area was majestic
The 1br Villa is a standout
The food was the best we had in Bali and the chef even cooked a special Balinese birthday feast for us which was served in our villa's garden

You will basically live in an appartement with your own garden and swimming pool (a real one!! where you can swim until you tired and then relax, the best thing ever, especially when you get up in the morning with the sunlight that comes in your bedroom and you just have to put your swimsuit on and go in the pool from the room!)The appartement are very spacious, with a interior living room but also an exterior
We were actually upgraded, to our surprise, to a 2-bedroom villa on our second night, which was beyond amazing
So fresh, using organic produce from the garden
The villas are divine and immaculately furnished, the gardens are like a botanical garden and individual villa pools areso lovely
The villa was very stylish, spacious, quiet and private
The garden was immaculately kept and had a breathtaking view, looking out across the adjoining jungle
The breeze, the sound of the leaves
Our villa with private gardens / pools / koi pond /entertaining area was huge
The Garden and landscaping is simple, but is ok and impression with small rice paddy
The private pools, the living area, the rooms, the garden seating decks, its all amazing
The villa we stayed in was simply gorgeous
It wasn’t our first time in Bali so we only left the villa to eat
In the mornings a farmer or two wld appear on the rice fields surrounding our villa and they were always friendly and smiling
It is a very clean and well run park
The location is set between lush green rice paddies and a deep narrow canyon covered with tropical plants and flowers

The villa we stayed in was spacious, private, well designed and furnished and offered a great combination of inside and outside: the bedrooms and most of one bathroom inside, the showers (nicely out of view) and sitting room (with wonderful view) outside, with a private swimming pool overlooking part of the garden and nature

Lot of the herbs come from their own garden and we saw one of the girls getting some herbs whilst we were waiting for our food!There is construction of the pool happening now so there is noise during daytime but this should be finished soon
Stayed at this villa which is about 1
Eat elsewhere, but make sure you plan time in your villa to relax
Swimming in the private pool in the beautiful garden, always make us feel really lucky
I made the reservation of the villa through Splendia
One thing to note if you don't like the elements, the living area can't be shut up and is open to the elements
The villas are set in large rice paddies that tier down towards a ravine area that is filled with lush greenery and palm trees
From the moment we arrived we were amazed with the beautiful gardens ,architecture and interior design
the good part is that i have hardely seen any mosquitos
They did not even bother to send us an email earlier, or even inform us before we entered the villa
We stayed in a very spacious “one bedroom villa”, surrounded by lush gardens and distant rain forest
Each villa appeared to be unique
Because you are located where you are, in stunning rural countryside, and the living/bathing areas are al fresco, you do get a good share of ants and bugs sharing your space
Perhaps some strategic planting might help disguise that! That said, the view down the valley from the venue was fantastic
Lily/Louts ponds and trees were everywhere, yet there wasn't a huge problem with mosquitoes, which meant a lot to me as I get bitten a lot and only got bitten about twice during our 5 day stay
The ever present dragonflies ( where the name Chapung comes from) and butterflies that flit around the gardens make it feel like a jungle wonderland

I still can't forget the taste of the Babi gulling with their organic rice freshly picked from the farm! One night is definitely not enough with this villa and we already are planning to go again very soon! Thank you so much for the experience, we can't wait to see you again!
For families with young children please note that the bedrooms are located at opposite ends of your private garden and you have to walk outside past the pool to access them
Did not have much mosquitoes as the housekeeping is making the necessary to avoid it even, if you stay in the living area as I did
They learnt all our names and even made a special flower board saying congratulations, which was so thoughtful
We made friends with the farmer working in the fields - he was so cute and friendly even though we could not communicate very well
The private villa with your
We were in villa six which was great
Clean and spacious with a common area for everyone to gather

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: From the moment we stepped in and were greeted with a fresh chilled juice and garlands of tropical flowers, everything was simply perfect
The villa was cleaned and otherwise serviced appropriately
We upgraded to a cliff top villa and have had a fantastic stay
Villa is amazing over 5,000 sq
If all you wanted to do was hang out in the villa, this would be the place for you

Sunsets from the grass lounge area above Rock bar are just as nice too and less busy If you're looking to indulge for a special occasion as well as relax with privacy then this is the place, although it does come with a higher price tag
Amazing villa and great inclusions, especially having a butler at our beck & call
Staff is very kind and as we were on honeymoon we were upgraded to the private vila with garden and pool
When we arrived at the hotel, we were upgraded to the Villa
Our villa was very big
About the villa itself -- it is spectacular
During our stay we stayed in cliff villa 3005 which is amazing for its position
The stay at Cliff Villa is non-comparable
Our Villa had everything we could wish for
You won't go wrong booking a villa if you can afford it
Another plus that came with our villa was our own butler 24/7
On our second day we had not had our villa made up until requested at 2

But their service leaves a lot to be desired- we ordered a private dinner on the villa gardens, they got half the order wrong! Although they have butlers, but they don't seem to understand the concept of a good concierge as they have no recommendations for Resteraunts or shopping areas if you ask them, which are the very basics for a good resort
My advice would be splash out on a villa

Upon arrival in Villa there is a hostess with a flower lei welcoming in you as well as a cold towel and fruit juice, oh by the way you have your own villa check in so you dont have to be crowded like the regular part of the hotel
The grounds were impeccable with beautiful flowers, trees, and perfectly manicured lawns
The best thing of staying at the villa is a private access to a gazebo, a balcony and a small swimming pool (approx
I could seriously live in this villa
We got upgraded to the villa and it was beyond our expectations

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: The valleys are beautiful, covered in green foliage
Villa even have electronic inspect repellent for you to use and mosquito coil for outside the room but if you want to walk around the place then bring own inspect repellent
The second room wasnt much better
There is terrace face to the tropical garden
The bungalow was clean and had everything we needed in it
We stayed at villa no1, it was very private, clean and nicely laid out
We loved it from the moment we stepped in through the lush, green garden along rice fields
But not the villa(spacious enough room) I was staying
The garden was beautiful and the view from the dining area and pool very nice
coconut trees, ricefields surroundings
The Indus restaraunt nearby is far superior, or even the Lotus Garden (part of the Lotus chain)

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: Many new Villa's have been built in Seminak over the last few years and they are crammed inside sprawling areas that spread for kilometers
Stayed in the 2 brm villa
We arrived at the Ahimsa Estate and drove into the car park
Nice brekkie cooked in your villa everyday (remember to order the night before)

The footpaths are definitely not pram friendly! The flea market next door was good and the locals that run the stores were very friendly - they loved our little boy and he wanted to drop by and see them every day
you basically feel like you're in a modern Balinese villa
The room was a good size, with living area outside, which is typical of Bali
Every villa we went to after we arrived, to check and verify was better!!The smell in the pool and in the bathrooms was unbelievable
If you are looking for a great villa right close to all the action
In summary, great location and fantastic villa
The Villa's themselves are appointed beautifully
Great bathroom, sort of indoor /outdoor with a big bath looking into the garden

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: The pool is almost always in the shade though, but who wants to hang out there when there are beaches close by
this is i reckon the best well priced hotel in the area
We are travelling as a couple and wanted something more than a hostel
The Local area of Seminyak is very safe (no problems at night)
Mine smelled a little funny
I was given flowers, a free night at the hotel, and most importantly, compassion
but hotel should improve some of area
We stayed in the cosy double which was perfect for sleeping and then going out and exploring the surrounding area
I guess that's the difference between Legian and Seminyak area
Room are a bit cramped for longer stays
Once my partner lost his helmet twice on the parking area and they managed to helped us
Hallways were soaked and full of blown leaves, and the doors have no thresholds for some weird cheap reason so they just put rolled towels down as sandbags
However a map of the local area and a few tips on things to do would have been great
not so busy area
They offered us all the facility that we needed
Usually I prefer a bungalow type hotel but this time I chose Grandma's by recommendation

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: As I arrived at night, all I could see were trees and hearing crickets
A very pleasant quiet garden setting with lovely staff and top service, they are genuinely interested in making sure you have a good time
We really loved being in the beautiful gardens and with the rice fields surrounding us
The room was dark, full of mosquitos even with the anti-mosquito turned on
For $50 or so for the basic Garden room, I find it a good value
I think that Tarum Harum cottages suffered in comparisson
The next day we where moved into the newer cottage but to be honest we really liked the decor of the older style rooms, and we hope they dont change them
Hotel's bungalows are hidden in amazing garden with statues and other decorations
There is really nothing to do in the nearby area
Great for taking day trips around the area
Beautiful gardens and lovely helpful staff
The hotel buildings are set along a pathway which is lined with lush foliage - the gardens really are very pleasant
We arrived at Taman Harum after 3:00am, walked along a path on a balmy night through lush vegetation to our two storied cottage

Immediately we booked another place to stay via tripadvisor and these cottages could not have been better! We were greeted with delicious welcome juices, great service and professionalism, and so many options for events at the hotel and outside of it! It was SO quaint and quiet, beautifully designed, and wildly peaceful! We felt like we were the only ones there!! Good food at the on site restaurant, better than most restaurants we ate at! Free DVDs to borrow after a night out, a pretty good massage onsite, and the best part was the free shuttle service! Why not stay in tranquility with free afternoon coffee/tea at the pool and then be driven into the chaos of Ubud for a dance performance and dinner
Very comfortable, modern and roomy with lovely views onto tropical gardens
Taman Harum Cottages has all of that
Taman Harum Cottages was a lovely place to stay in Ubud, Bali
Although the bathroom had a pink bathtub from the 70s which opened into a small garden, it was clean
Like staying in a garden art gallery
The cottages are having two levels, two bathrooms, two large beds, and living area
Taman Harum Cottages lived up to my expectations and more
I've been to Bali many times, and have stayed near Ubud on several occasions and I found the Taman Harum Cottages to be a real treasure
The cottages are quiet and we felt very safe
The grounds of Taman Harum were beautiful gardens & a wonderful wood carving gallery
The room had good air conditioning, a garden bathroom, lots of hot water and electronic mosquito repellent devices on each level
This allows free flowing air which means mosquitos, ants, etc can access the inside of the cottage

The cottage was just beautiful, our outdoor bathroom magic, the staff were always smiling and so helpful the complimentary car into town was fantastic, most of the drivers would point out places of interest
The cottages are fully surrounded of trees, plants, statues, flowers
It is located on a busy, dusty road but once you enter the gates, lovely gardens envelope the hotel and provide a welcome respite from the chaos that defines southeast Asia
Nice dinning area, a very relaxed atmosphere throughout
I stayed at a hotel called Taman Harum, or perfumed garden, in the village of Mas, for 2 nights in November 2011
The grounds feel as if they have a thousand fountains and are lovingly tended! Spacious rooms with good wi-fi, clean and light
We are looking forward to a return to Taman Harum Cottages, we will certainly visit again
We stayed at the Taman Harum Cottages in March of 2013
A bell-boy took us to our cottage and showed us where everything was
There is a game area where you can play chess (didn't really explored this part but we've gone pass by it while walking around) and hangout
The cottage was good and the view from the first floor bathroom (into the farming field) was very special
He even offered to take us to the Batik factory though we declined owing to fatigue
I took the Honeymoon package at Taman Harum Cottages (on August 2013)
The hotel has beautiful grounds full of trees, birds, and old Balinese details
We did have a lovely time here and even got flowers for my birthday
The hotel itself is relatively sprawling with beautiful statues, fountains and gardens

They are indeed located amongst the lush green garden which also a convenient home for those insects, but by finding the right way (weekly fogging, for example) they will certainly minimize this problem

We had passed by Ubud earlier on but had never stayed there so we wanted some place that represented what Ubud stands for and after surfing the net for couple of hours, settled for Taman Harum Cottages

address: Jalan Nakula No. 18, Seminyak, Bali 80361, Indonesia

reviews.review: Beautiful tropical garden, very relaxing
Well worth a look if you are considering the area
